item.title: A sshlockout Tutorial
item.description: This is a appreciation article to sshlockout. Yep I’m a shill. The sshlockout program is a extra layer of security that bans IP addresses that have reached a maximum threshold of failed password attempts. If you’re from the Linux world this is similar to Fail2Ban and is a very simple program. When sshlockout is setup using the manpage’s defaults it will ban any IP address that exceeds the threshold of 5 incorrect passwords in one hour and expire them in 1 day.
